page.title: 01Cwm Tafohog
page.content: This block of high bleek moorland lies to the south of the A458T. The highest peak - Mymydd Llyn Coch Hwyad - is 503m high. The moorland is by the north flowing Afon Tafolog which is a tributary of Afon Dugoco whose water eventually join with the river Dovey. A poorly maintained unclassified road follows the valley to its before dropping down towards llanbry much of the land is rough grazing and is used for sheep rearing although areas are now under conifer forests. is now confined to the floor of the valley.
